propDescriptions.action: A ref for imperative actions. It currently only supports focusVisible() action.
propDescriptions.color: The color of the component. It supports those theme colors that make sense for this component. To learn how to add your own colors, check out Themed components—Extend colors.
propDescriptions.component: The component used for the root node. Either a string to use a HTML element or a component.
propDescriptions.focusVisibleClassName: This prop can help identify which element has keyboard focus. The class name will be applied when the element gains the focus through keyboard interaction. It's a polyfill for the CSS :focus-visible selector. The rationale for using this feature is explained here. A polyfill can be used to apply a focus-visible class to other components if needed.
propDescriptions.size: The size of the component. To learn how to add custom sizes to the component, check out Themed components—Extend sizes.
propDescriptions.sx: The system prop that allows defining system overrides as well as additional CSS styles. See the `sx` page for more details.
propDescriptions.variant: The global variant to use. To learn how to add your own variants, check out Themed components—Extend variants.
